page.title: 04CYCLE OF FARMWORK-STAMBOURNE
page.content: Has changed little except for a few new implements to break up soil after or instead of ploughing. Land is ploughed, power harrowed, drilled with seed corn & fertiliser (potash & phosphate at 2cwt per acre), harrowed and rolled. At end October/ beginning November, crops sprayed for Wild Oat and Blackgrass control. Late February, Nitrogen fertiliser at 1.5 cwt per acre. Again in April at 2.5cwt per acre. In April, spray for Eyespot and broad-leafed weed control. Mid- June, spray a fungicide with aphis control. Barley is harvested end July, wheat early August. After harvest straw is either baled or chopped with an attachment on the combine harvester and then burnt. Baled straw is used for animals or fuel. If a farm has any manure it is spread prior to ploughing By end August harvest is over.
